intro: Frasera albicaulis, commonly known as the white fir or whiteflower frasera, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Aristolochiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. Frasera albicaulis is often found in open coniferous forests and is adapted to cool, humid climates.
